properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 28 at 3:25AM AKST until January 29 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations
of up to 15 inches. Northerly winds of 20 to 30 mph with gusts
as high as 50 mph are expected.

* WHERE...Alaska Peninsula. The worst conditions will be on the
Bering side.

* WHEN...From 9 AM this morning to 6 PM AKST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow
will significantly reduce visibility to less than one half
mile. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause
frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of snow and blowing snow
will reduce visibility to less than one half mile in strong
northerly winds.
properties.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM AKST WEDNESDAY
